before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"68hnb","text":"Shipping and Storage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7btlr","text":"The enzymes provided in this kit are temperature sensitive, and appropriate care should be taken during shipping and","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"616a8","text":"storage. KAPA HyperPlus Kits are shipped on dry ice or ice packs, depending upon country of destination. Upon","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahev2","text":"receipt, immediately store enzymes and reaction buffers at -15°C to -25°C in a constant-temperature freezer. When","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3php7","text":"stored under these conditions and handled correctly, the kit components will retain full activity until the expiry date","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8uqr","text":"indicated on the kit label.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ai3i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6058c","text":"Handling","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"deoht","text":"Always ensure that KAPA HyperPlus Kit components have been fully thawed and thoroughly mixed before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asotp","text":"The End Repair \u0026 A-Tailing Buffer and Ligation Buffer may contain precipitates when thawed at 2°C to 8°C. These","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5jro","text":"buffers must be thawed at room temperature and vortexed thoroughly before use. KAPA HiFi HotStart ReadyMix (2X)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a01es","text":"contains isostabilizers and may not freeze completely, even when stored at -15°C to -25°C. Nevertheless, always","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32i0d","text":"ensure that the ReadyMix is fully thawed and thoroughly mixed before use. Reaction master mixes prepared from","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t1cj","text":"the enzymes and buffers for fragmentation, end repair and A-tailing, as well as for ligation, are very viscous and","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"di32o","text":"require special attention during pipetting. Keep all enzyme components and master mixes on ice as long as possible","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1vhf","text":"during handling and preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7mmv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ankst","text":"Quality Control","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccb5","text":"All kit components are subjected to stringent functional quality control, are free of detectable contaminating exoand","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jr0s","text":"endonuclease activities, and meet strict requirements with respect to DNA contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b32gh","text":"The standard fragmentation temperature is 37°C. If you are fragmenting high-quality genomic DNA, any other","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcbuq","text":"high-complexity DNA sample, or FFPE DNA to a mode fragment length \u003c500 bp, it is unlikely that you will have to","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fp6om","text":"change or optimize the fragmentation temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1vb8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23fe4","text":"Low-complexity samples (e.g., small viral genomes, plasmids, long amplicons and cDNA) may, however, be","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a3ep","text":"over-fragmented at 37°C, even with short incubation times. The likelihood of over-fragmentation depends on","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1rgm","text":"the nature, molecular weight/length of the input DNA, the desired size distribution after fragmentation and, to a lesser","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36vg","text":"degree, the DNA input into fragmentation. For example,  100 ng of a 1.8 kb PCR product will yield a similar mode","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"308bq","text":"fragment length (~300 bp) as 100 ng E. coli or human genomic DNA when fragmented at 37°C for 10 min,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajgeb","text":"whereas 1 ng of a 1 kb PCR product will be fragmented to a mode size \u003c250 bp using the same parameters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9h05v","text":"To determine the optimal fragmentation parameters for low-complexity samples, or high-complexity samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpbvb","text":"when the desired mode fragment length is \u003e500 bp:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ic7n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"chc6o","text":"Set up four replicate reactions with a non-precious, bulk sample that is representative of the actual samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30dbm","text":"to be processed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Optimization of Fragmentation Temperature
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"45lnr","text":"Safe Stopping Points","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pie8","text":"The library construction process, from enzymatic fragmentation to final library, can be performed in","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6n9m","text":"1.5 to 3 hrs—depending on experience, the number of samples being processed, and whether or not library","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d0m9","text":"amplification is performed. If necessary, the protocol may be paused safely after completion of the Post-ligation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fb6e","text":"Cleanup (step 4.17; the end of the protocol for PCR-free workflows). Purified, adapter-ligated library DNA may be stored at 2°C to 8°C for 1 – 2 weeks, or at -15°C to -25°C for ≤1 month before amplification, target capture and/or sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcibg","text":"To avoid degradation, always store DNA in a buffered solution (10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0 – 8.5) when possible,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebu5t","text":"and minimize the number of freeze-thaw cycles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94n7p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0dn2","text":"Notes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fotdq","text":"First-time users should refer to Appendix 2: Optimization of Fragmentation Parameters (p. 16)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4huov","text":"before trying this kit, as standard fragmentation parameters may not result in the optimal size distribution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gbb2","text":"for libraries prepared from your specific DNA samples. Precious samples should not be used when evaluating","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qsgg","text":"this kit. Instead, parameters should be optimized with a non-precious, bulk DNA sample that is representative","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3c6mk","text":"of the actual samples to be processed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7msov","text":"If your DNA samples contain EDTA, please consult the Appendix 2: Handling of DNA Samples Containing EDTA (p. 16), as well as Important Parameters: Input DNA (p. 4) before starting this protocol. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chdq2","text":"This protocol does not include size selection. Please refer to Appendix 1 (p. 15) for a detailed double-sided","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49kv9","text":"     size selection protocol that may be included after ligation or after amplification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"vv4r","text":"Always ensure that KAPA cleanup beads are fully equilibrated to room temperature and fully resuspended","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fuuri","text":"    before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
